subject: history
title: European Powers in India: Comparative Analysis
description: Comparison of Portuguese, Dutch, English, French, and Danish presence in India

summary.title: Key Takeaways
points: Portuguese: First to arrive, but couldn't sustain due to limited resources and competition
Dutch: Strong commercially but focused on Indonesia; didn't compete for Indian territories
English: Eventually became dominant; superior organization, diplomacy, and military
French: Strongest competitor to English; brilliant military strategy but lost in Carnatic Wars
Danish: Minor role; peaceful traders; couldn't compete with major powers
summary.examTip: Remember chronological order: Portuguese (1498) â†’ Dutch (1602) â†’ English (1600 charter, 1608 arrival) â†’ French (1664) â†’ Danish (1620). English ultimately succeeded due to strong organization, Industrial Revolution backing, and military superiority.
